<title level="1" right="Rules">[Line of Sight](/Rules.aspx?ID=2383)</title>

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 427 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">
<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">
Some effects require you to have line of sight to your target. As long as you can precisely sense the area (as described in [Precise Senses](/Rules.aspx?ID=2406)) and it is not blocked by a solid barrier (as described in [Cover](/Rules.aspx?ID=2372)), you have line of sight. An area of [darkness](/Rules.aspx?ID=2404) prevents line of sight if you don’t have [darkvision](/Rules.aspx?ID=2410), but portcullises and other obstacles that aren’t totally solid do not. Usually a 1-foot-square gap is enough to maintain line of sight, though the GM makes the final call.
</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>
